content:
• Friday, May 18, 2018
  • EVHC

    Reuters: HCA, KKR teaming on Envision buyout bid; EVHC +7.8%

    • Envision Healthcare (NYSE:EVHC) has jumped 7.8% after hours as Reuters reports HCA Healthcare (NYSE:HCA) and KKR are teaming up for a buyout bid.
    • That team-up should give the two an edge over other buyout firms eyeing Envision, including a consortium of Carlyle Group (NASDAQ:CG) and TPG Global, according to the report.
    • HCA has its eyes on Envision's AmSurg ambulatory surgery unit, with KKR planning to take over the rest.
    • Envision sold off its AMR ambulance unit to Air Medical last year for $2.4B. It had merged with AmSurg the year before that in an all-stock deal that would be undone by this bid.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • HGSH

    China HGS Real Estate spikes in closing minutes to 30% gain

    • China HGS Real Estate (NASDAQ:HGSH) ended the day as one of Nasdaq's top gainers with a spike in the last 10 minutes of trading.
    • On heavy volume, shares jumped to a 30.2% gain on no obvious news.
    • Volume ran more than 17 times normal for the thinly traded stock.
    • Shares are now off 6.2% in postmarket trade.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM | 5 Comments

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (05/18/2018)

    • Top Losers: EGY -1.9%. MX -1.4%.

  • GTXI

    GTx's enobosarm continues to demonstrate treatment effect in mid-stage SUI study

    • Updated results from a Phase 2 proof-of-concept clinical trial evaluating GTx's (GTXI +1.4%) enobosarm in postmenopausal women with stress urinary incontinence (SUI) continued to show a treatment benefit. The data were presented at the American Urological Association Annual Meeting in San Francisco.
    • All 18 women who completed the 12-week treatment period experienced clinically meaningful reductions (at least 50%) in SUI episodes per day (the primary endpoint). Mean stress leaks declined 81% from baseline.
    • No serious adverse events were observed.
    • Patients will be followed for up to seven months post-treatment. To date, none have returned to baseline, including the 17 participants who have reached seven months.
    • Topline data from an ongoing Phase 2 randomized, placebo-controlled study, ASTRID, should be available in Q4.
    • Enobosarm is a non-steroidal androgen receptor agonist also being investigated for the treatment of endocrine-sensitive advanced breast cancer prior to chemotherapy.
    • Previously: GTx's enobosarm shows treatment effect in mid-stage study in postmenopausal women with stress urinary incontinence; shares up 14% premarket (June 12, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM | 2 Comments
  • SBGL

    Reuters: Sibanye CEO confident of Lonmin takeover despite cash burn

    • Sibanye-Stillwater (SBGL -2.6%) remains confident that its planned $386M purchase of Lonmin (OTC:LNMIF) will proceed, CEO Neal Froneman tells Reuters, but the platinum producer must slow its cash burn and achieve certain production targets.
    • Lonmin said earlier this week that its net cash position had dropped to $17M from $63M at year-end 2017 but that it intended to recover $47M in H2 of this year; in reaction, Froneman says "There is a duty on Lonmin management to deliver... I’m not panicking. I’m very confident in their ability to meet their targets."
    • Froneman also says SBGL, which bought Aquarius Platinum, Anglo American Platinum’s Rustenburg assets and U.S.-based Stillwater in recent, will not seek any additional assets in the short term.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM | 45 Comments
  • UAVS

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 PM (05/18/2018)

    • Gainers: UAVS +15%. SE +12%. GDS +9%. INVE +8%. OOMA +6%.
    • Losers: BOXL -15%. RNET -10%. BIDU -9%. SGH -9%. VECO -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • USCR

    U.S. Concrete reiterated a Buy at DA Davidson despite short report

    • U.S. Concrete (USCR -2.5%) is maintained with a Buy rating and $95 price target at DA Davidson, which continues to find the shares attractive following yesterday's short report from Spruce Point.
    • While a bear thesis calling an end to the cycle may never completely abate as long as revenue continues to grow, stronger Q2 and Q3 results may help ease concerns regarding cycle momentum, analyst Brent Thielman says.
    • The firm argues USCR's annual gross margins have been stable for three straight years, albeit with evident quarter-to-quarter fluctuations.
    • Stifel also reiterates its Buy rating, saying Spruce Point's short thesis is not new and is similar to a short report from another firm released about two years ago; the firm thinks the fundamental outlook for the business remains encouraging.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM | 9 Comments
  • VIA

    Bloomberg: Court finds for Viacom directors in Redstone pay dispute

    • An appeals court has ruled for the board at Viacom (VIA -2.3%, VIAB -2.6%), dismissing investor claims that the company overpaid founder Sumner Redstone, Bloomberg reports.
    • Investors had charged directors with being too complacent about approving $15M in pay and bonuses for Redstone as his mental capacity declined.
    • But the Delaware Supreme Court upheld a judge's finding that a 2016 settlement resolved those complaints.
    • The judge who dismissed the Viacom investor claims last year, Judge Andre Bouchard, is presiding over the latest Redstone-related court battle: a lawsuit by CBS looking to strip the Redstone family's voting control of the company.
    • Previously: CBS board votes to strip Redstones' voting control of company (updated) (May. 17 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • AMZN

    WaPo: Trump pushed Postmaster General to double Amazon fees

    • Washington Post sources say President Trump pushed U.S. Postmaster General Megan Brennan to double the rate charged to Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) and other companies to ship packages.
    • Brennan has resisted, explaining that the arrangements are under contracts and need review by a regulatory commission.   
    • Brennan also explained that the relationship with Amazon is beneficial for the Postal Service. 
    • Amazon spent $21.7B on shipping in 2017, which includes sorting, delivery center, and transport charges. Analysts think the Postal Service delivers roughly 40% of Amazon packages. 
    • The Postal Service reported shipping and package income of $19.5B last year (+12% Y/Y) but lost money mainly due to first-class mail declines. 
    • Amazon shares are down 0.5% to $1,574.43.    
    • Previously: Amazon -4.3% after another Trump tweet (April 2)
    • Previously: Amazon -1% on Trump tweet suggesting post office collusion (April 3)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM | 226 Comments
  • WMLP-OLD

  • CPB

    Campbell Soup back in the political crosshairs

    • Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross took a shot at Campbell Soup (CPB -11.9%) by claiming that the company is blaming tariffs for its lack of profits. While Campbell didn't point to tariffs as the reason behind its $393M net loss in Q1 as indicated by Ross, the subject did come up on the post-earnings conference call.
    • Here's exactly what Campbell CFO Anthony Disilvestreo said on the call (transcript): "At this stage, given what we know about accelerating cost inflation, in part due to the anticipated impact of import tariffs and the continuing headwind on transportation and logistics cost, we expect our margins will be down in fiscal 2019."
    • Previously: Packaged food stocks follow Campbell Soup lower (May 18)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM | 25 Comments
  • AFSI

    KBW warns on Icahn's AmTrust involvement

    • Should Carl Icahn somehow get in the way of the AmTrust (NASDAQ:AFSI) going-private deal, shares are far more likely to tumble, rather than go higher, says analyst Meyer Shields.
    • He's not sure the Zyskind/Karfunkel family will agree to another boost to their bid, and there's no assurance a third party would step in.
    • He continues to rate the shares at Market Perform.
    • Source: Bloomberg
    • The stock's up 2.6% today to $13.78.
    • Previously: AmTrust up nearly 7% as Icahn discloses stake (May 17)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM | 12 Comments

  • PHIO

    RXi Pharma's Samcyprone successful in mid-stage wart study; shares ahead 10%

    • Nano cap RXi Pharmaceuticals (RXII +9.8%) is up on triple normal volume on the heels of its announcement of positive results from a Phase 2 clinical trial, RXI-SCP-1502, evaluating topical med Samcyprone (diphenylcyclopropenone) for the treatment of common warts. The data were presented at the International Investigative Dermatology Conference in Washington, D.C.
    • At end of the once-weekly 10-week treatment period, more than 70% of warts were reduced in size by more than 50%. Complete wart clearance was 54% and up to 71% for certain wart types (non-plantar).
    • On the safety front, there were no treatment-related serious adverse events nor any dose-limiting toxicities. Most of the adverse events observed were mild skin reactions.
    • The company says the results were achieved without any wart preparation, such as soaking or abrasion, typically done before treatment with salicylic acid, the most common first-line treatment.
    • Previously: RXi Pharma initiates mid-stage study of Samcyprone for the treatment of warts (Dec. 21, 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM | 8 Comments

  • DELL

    Dell talking to shareholders about full VMware merger; DVMT +5.8%

    • Dell (DVMT) is talking with shareholders to gauge interest in a full merger between the company and VMware (NYSE:VMW), according to CNBC sources.
    • Owners of the tracking stock own shares that track VMware performance but not the rest of Dell. 
    • Dell wants to own as much VMware as it can while also cleaning up its capital structure after a string of mergers and spin-outs. 
    • In a public filing, Dell says it’s still considering an IPO, VMware merger, doing nothing, or exchanging its common stock (held by Michael Dell and Silver Lake) for DVMT shares.   
    • DVMT shares are up 5.8% to $78.63. 
    • VMware shares are up 1.3%.    
    • Previously: VMware +6.8% as Dell leans against reverse merger (April 16)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM
  • SEE

    Sealed Air started at Buy at Jefferies as best positioned to benefit from trends

    • Sealed Air (SEE +1.8%) is initiated with a Buy rating and $53 price target at Jefferies, which says the company is best positioned among packaging companies from changing consumer trends within the domestic sector and growing demand in emerging markets.
    • Jefferies analyst Daniel Rizzo says the recent pullback in packaging companies makes for an attractive entry point, citing free cash flow yields averaging 7% and relatively stable end markets.
    • Rizzo says SEE should offset a lack of pass-thru pricing and a rise in PE costs with cost cuts and price hikes.
    • Also in the group, Jefferies rates Graphic Packaging (GPK +0.4%) as a Buy with a $20 price target, AptarGroup (ATR +0.6%) with a Hold and a $99 target, and Bemis (BMS -0.4%) with a Hold and a $46 target.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word
     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • NDRA

    ENDRA Life Sciences continues post-IPO stumble, down 14%

    • Thinly traded nano cap ENDRA Life Sciences (NDRA -14%) adds to its retreat since debuting at $5/unit on May 9. Each unit consisted of one share of common stock and one five-year warrant to purchase one share of common at $6.25. Shares are currently exchanging hands at $1.93.
    • The company develops technologies that improve the performance of ultrasound systems.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM
  • PRMW

    Primo announces pricing of follow-on public offering of common stock

    • Primo Water (PRMW +4%) prices underwritten public offering of 4.643M shares of its common stock at a price of $14.00/share to the public.
    • The offering is expected to close on or about May 22, 2018, subject to the satisfaction of customary closing conditions.
    • Press Release

  • RAVN

    Raven Industries slides 10% despite strong margins

    • Raven Industries (RAVN -10.4%) reports Q1 revenue growth of 18.8% Y/Y to $111.13M of which Applied Technology was $40.4M (-0.1% Y/Y); Engineered Films $60M (+37.7% Y/Y) & Aerostar $10.9M (+13.5% Y/Y).
    • Segment operating margin: Applied Technology increased 620 bps to 39.4%; Engineered Films increased 200 bps to 22% & Aerostar increased 1,090 bps to 25.7%.
    • Segment EBIDTA margin: Applied Technology increased 600 bps to 41.3%; Engineered Films increased 110 bps to 25.9% & Aerostar increased 860 bps to 27.7%.
    • Cash proceeds from the sale of SST & continued strength in operating cash flows principally drove the increase in cash & equivalents by 26.6% Q/Q to $51.3M.
    • Net working capital of 24.1% & expects $22M of Capex for 2019.
    • Previously: Raven beats by $0.12, misses on revenue (May. 17 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM
  • MLNX

    Piper Jaffray upgrades Mellanox to 15% upside

    • Piper Jaffray upgrades Mellanox Tech (NASDAQ:MLNX) from Neutral to Overweight and raises the price target from $84 to $100.
    • New target represents a 15% upside to yesterday’s close. 
    • Mellanox shares are down 1.2% to $86.02.  
     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • DE

    Deere +6% on pledge to raise equipment prices to fight rising costs

    • Deere (DE +6.4%) says it will cut costs and raise equipment prices this year to protect profits, sending shares sharply higher.
    • Higher freight and raw materials costs caused DE to miss Q2 earnings estimates but the company now expects full-year adjusted earnings of $3.1B, higher than $2.85B forecast earlier, with full-year equipment sales forecast to rise by ~30% Y/Y to $33.7B and Q3 equipment sales jumping 35%.
    • DE's cost of sales soared 35% percent in the quarter from a year ago, and it expects input costs during the year to come in higher than its earlier outlook.
    • Today's stock surge may be taking analysts by surprise who were underwhelmed by DE's Q2 results and "tepid"guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM | 6 Comments

  • FCAU

    Fiat Chrysler lower on another emissions cheating reveal

    • Fiat Chrysler (NYSE:FCAU) is down 1.66% after a report from Bloomberg News indicates that the automaker discussed using illegal software to cheat emissions tests as far back as 2010.
    • A Fiat employee tried to convince an exec at a supplier in e-mails that the software shouldn't be considered a mechanism to fool emissions tests.
    • The e-mails were release today in testimony at a federal court in San Francisco.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • NXPI

    NXP, Qualcomm gain on encouraging word out of Beijing

    • NXP Semiconductors (NASDAQ:NXPI) gains 4.8% on encouraging word out of Beijing about its acquisition by Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM).
    • The WSJ quotes a Beijing official: “The Qualcomm/NXP deal is looking more optimistic now.” 
    • Qualcomm shares are up 1.6% to $57.87.  
     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM | 45 Comments

    Merck recovers from FDA alert-stoked selloff

    • Merck (MRK +0.1%) has recovered from a spike in selling apparently caused by an FDA alert (unable to locate) on an efficiency issue found for certain patients being treated with Keytruda (pembrolizumab) or Roche's (OTCQX:RHHBY +0.7%) Tecentriq (atezolizumab). Shares were down almost 3% before recovering.
    • Roche did not experience any selling pressure.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM | 13 Comments
  • SSNNF

    DRAM prices decline, Micron -2.8%

    • DRAM market dynamics “have rather abruptly shifted,” according to Notable Calls citing a “well respected Technology shop.”
    • The pricing looks less bullish with DRAM falling below expectations. 
    • Notable Calls also says Nomura says DRAM pricing declined W/W, according to the firm’s checks. 
    • Top DRAM players: Samsung (OTC:SSNNF, OTC:SSNLF)
      SK Hynix (OTC:HXSCF, OTC:HXSCL), and Micron (MU -2.6%).
    • Micron has its analyst day event on Monday, which could become a catalyst.   
    • Micron shares are down 2.8% to $53.24.   
    • Previously: RBC sees analyst day as catalyst for Micron (May 18)
    • Previously: Chip stocks slump on Applied Materials earnings, guidance (May 18)

  • AMRS

    Amyris, Chevron to develop and market renewable base oil technologies

    • Amyris (AMRS +4.5%) moves sharply higher after announcing an agreement with Chevron (CVX -0.9%) to jointly develop and market new renewable base oil technologies; financial terms are not disclosed.
    • AMRS, CVX and other firms already market renewable oils through their Novvi joint venture, and the new agreement expands the relationship to include base oil development and commercialization.
    • The companies say the venture will combine Novvi's expertise in working with renewable feeds with CVX's expertise in hydroprocessing technology
     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM | 3 Comments
  • ZEN

    Stifel raises its Zendesk target to 9% downside; shares +2.8%

    • Stifel maintains a Hold rating but raises its Zendesk (NYSE:ZEN) price target from $45 to $50.
    • The new target represents a 9% downside to yesterday’s close. 
    • Zendesk share are up 2.8% to $56.64.  
     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • ORPN

    Bioblast Pharma up 33%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Bioblast Pharma (ORPN +33.3%) is up on more than a 10x surge in volume.
    • No particular news accounts for the action, but the company is facing a capital raise. At year-end 2017, it had ~$3.5M in cash and equivalents while operations consumed ~$6.4M during the year.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM | 1 Comment
  • TARO

    More on Taro Pharmaceutical Q4 results

    • Taro Pharmaceutical (TARO -1.4%) reports Q4 revenue decrease of 10.8% Y/Y to $175.22M; despite an increase in overall volumes revenues were down due to continuing increased competition and the challenging pricing environment, particularly in the U.S.
    • Q1 Margins: Gross declined 530 bps to 67.9% & operating declines 910 bps to 42.7%.
    • Q1 Expenses: R&D was $20.3M (+2% Y/Y) & S,G&A was $23.8M (+17.8% Y/Y).
    • Cash flow by operations for the year was $323.7M (-26% Y/Y); Cash, including short-term & long-term bank deposits & marketable securities, increased $190.8M to $1.6B, as cash reflects the $107M impact from the company’s share repurchase program.
    • The company repurchased 1.09M shares at an average price of $102.52.
    • Previously: Taro Pharmaceutical reports Q4 results (May. 17 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • ABEO

    Abeo down 12% on gene therapy data in Sanfilippo

    • Abeona Therapeutics (ABEO -11.5%) is down on a 50% spike in volume following its release of updated data from a Phase 1/2 clinical trial assessing gene therapy ABO-102 in patients with Sanfilippo syndrome type A (MPS III A), a rare inherited disorder characterized by the buildup of sugar molecules in tissues and organs leading to a range of health problems.
    • To date, 11 patients have received a single intravenous injection of ABO-102 which delivers the missing gene associated with the disease.
    • Reductions in heparan sulfate, the hallmark sugar molecule in MPS III A, in cerebral spinal fluid were 25.8 - 67.1% at day 30 (3 - 4 patients), 58.7 - 83.3% at day 180 (1 -3 patients) and 65.7 - 69.3% at day 360 (2 patients).
    • In urine, the reductions in heparan sulfate ranged from 29.2 - 90.3% from day 30 to day 540.
    • Patients experienced durable biophysical reductions of disease burden, including reductions in liver volume.
    • On the safety front, no treatment-related serious adverse events were observed.
    • Investors appeared to have sold on the news since shares were initially down almost 26% before recovering.
    • Previously: Abeona's gene therapy candidate for Sanfilippo B shows encouraging effect in first patient; shares up 12% (Feb. 7)
    • Previously: Abeona rebounds from bearish report-stoked selloff, up 1% (Feb. 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM | 30 Comments
  • CUI

    CUI Global Subsidiary Secures Second Biomethane Contract

    • CUI Global's (CUI +1.4%) subsidiary, Orbital Gas Systems Ltd., was awarded a second contract valued in excess of $500K for a biomethane-to-grid unit by a major European industrial company.
    • The new contract calls for the provision of one biomethane-to-grid unit to be delivered in 2018.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • MDP

    Report: Meredith sees $200M bids for Time, Fortune/Money brands

    • Meredith (MDP +4%) is seeing healthy bidding for the magazine brand divestments tied to its acquisition of Time Inc., the New York Post reports.
    • With first-round bids having arrived last week, Time has drawn bids of close to $200M, and so has a combination of Fortune and Money.
    • Sports Illustrated has reportedly been seeing bids close to that amount as well, in a sale handled by Houlihan Lokey.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM | 3 Comments
  • GME

    GameStop lower as BAML stays negative

    • GameStop (NYSE:GME) is down 5.85% after Bank of America Merrill Lynch reiterates an Underperform rating on the retailer.
    • The investment firm points to weak software sales data for April in staying negative on GameStop.
    • BAML's price target on GameStop is $10. The 52-week low on GameStop is $12.20.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM | 30 Comments
  • TYHT

    Shineco up 21% on bullish FQ3 results

    • Thinly traded nano cap Shineco (TYHT +20.6%) is up on a whopping 41x surge in volume after releasing positive fiscal Q3 results.
    • Revenue was up 68% to $13.34M while earnings jumped 137% to $4.55M.
    • The key driver was its Luobuma herbal medicine line which generated $5.48M in sales, up 389%. The increase was primarily due to the establishment of a new subsidiary, Xinjiang Taihe, which generated revenue of ~$5.2M.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • CPB

    Packaged food stocks follow Campbell Soup lower

    • Campbell Soup (NYSE:CPB) is down 11.9% on a post-earnings slide that worsened during the company's conference call when it warned of the negative impact of tariffs on margins this year.
    • The tariff warning and soft overall Q1 report from Campbell Soup is dragging parts of the packaged foods sector down.
    • Notable movers include B&G Foods (NYSE:BGS) -6.1%, General Mills (NYSE:GIS) -3.8%, J.M. Smucker (NYSE:SJM) -3.3%, McCormick (NYSE:MKC) -3.1%, Kellogg (NYSE:K) -2.6%, Flower Foods (NYSE:FLO) -2.2%, ConAgra Brands (NYSE:CAG) -2.2% and Hostess Brands (NASDAQ:TWNK) -1.5%.
    • Previously: Campbell Soup CEO retires (May 18)
    • Previously: Campbell Soup lower by 5% after results, CEO exit (May 18)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM | 71 Comments
  • AGRX

    Agile Therapeutics down 76% on additional work needed for U.S. approval of Twirla

    • Thinly traded nano cap Agile Therapeutics (AGRX -75.9%) is down on a 20x surge in volume in response to its announcement of FDA feedback related to its second CRL for contraceptive patch Twirla.
    • Per the official minutes from their April 16 meeting, the agency informed the company that it still has "significant concerns" regarding the adhesion of Twirla, a deficiency that it believes cannot be adequately addressed through its proposed patient compliance programs so the product needs reformulating followed by a formal adhesion study to confirm its performance.
    • The FDA also wants bioequivalence data on the new formulation versus the original. If bioequivalence cannot be demonstrated, then a new Phase 3 trial will be needed.
    • In addition, there may be more work required to address manufacturing issues.
    • The agency indicated that an advisory committee review would be probable upon the resubmission and acceptance of an updated application.
    • Previously: Agile strikes out again on U.S. OK of contraceptive patch Twirla (Dec. 22, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM | 8 Comments
  • MTEX

    Mannatech tenders for shares; stock jumps 24%

    • Mannatech (MTEX +23.9%) commences a Dutch auction for up to $16M in common stock between $18.50 and $21.00 per share.
    • At $20 per share, that would be 800K shares vs. current float of 2.7M.
    • Today's gain brings the price to $19.70.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM
  • AMAT

    Chip stocks slump on Applied Materials earnings, guidance

    • Applied Materials (AMAT -9.3%) earnings report and downside revenue guidance are tugging down chip stocks this morning.
    • On the move: Lam Research (LRCX -4.5%), Universal Display (OLED -4.9%), KLA-Tencor (KLAC -3.7%), Teradyne (TER -1.9%), Qorvo (QRVO -1.4%), Skyworks Solutions (SWKS -1%), FormFactor (FORM -2.3%), Micron (MU -0.9%), Intel (INTC -1.1%), Amkor Technology (AMKR -2.4%). 
    • Semiconductor ETFs: SOXL, SOXX, SMH, USD, PSI, XSD, SOXS, SSG, FTXL, XTH
     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM | 74 Comments
  • OPK

    OPKO facing proposed non-coverage of 4Kscore by Medicare; shares down 4%

    • OPKO Health (OPK -3.5%) slips on light volume out the gate this morning on the heels of a draft policy by Medicare administrative services provider Novitas Solutions denying coverage for its 4Kscore test.
    • The company intends to submit comments during the public comment period ending July 5.
    • Previously: Long-term study results support value of OPKO's 4Kscore prostate cancer test (March 16)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM | 44 Comments
  • GLCNF

    Bloomberg: Glencore may face U.K. bribery probe over Congo dealings

    • Glencore (OTCPK:GLCNF, OTCPK:GLNCY) -6.8% in London trading, its worst decline in nearly two years, following a report that it may face a bribery probe by the U.K.’s Serious Fraud Office over its ties to Israeli billionaire Dan Gertler in the Democratic Republic of Congo.
    • The SFO is planning to seek formal approval for a probe into Glencore’s dealings in DRC with its former business partner, according to a Bloomberg report.

  • INSY

    INSYS down 5% premarket on Ad Com doc release

    • INSYS Therapeutics (NASDAQ:INSY) slips 5% premarket on light volume on the heels of the release of briefing documents for next Tuesday's Ad Com review for Buvaya.
    • Per the FDA document (page 25): "In conclusion, the Applicant’s efficacy data demonstrate superiority of [Buvaya] over placebo for all doses tested, however time to onset of analgesia is later than is optimal for a drug intended to treat acute pain and the need for rescue analgesic was high. From a safety perspective, there is an unexpectedly high rate of nausea, vomiting and dizziness for [Buvaya]. And the Applicant showed in a comparative safety study that rates for [Buvaya] are markedly higher than rates for other opioids (morphine and oxycodone) used in similar acute pain settings. The totality of data submitted by the Applicant does not support the use of this product in an acute pain setting, based on both efficacy and safety findings."
    • Previously: Ad Com review next week for INSYS Therapeutics' pain med buprenorphine sublingual spray (May 18)

  • VLRX

    Two studies support value proposition of Valeritas' V-Go Insulin Delivery device; shares up 21% premarket

    • Nano cap Valeritas Holdings (NASDAQ:VLRX) is up 21% premarket on average volume on the heels of its announcement of results from two studies assessing its V-Go Wearable Insulin Delivery device. The results were presented at the American Association of Clinical Endocrinologists Annual Scientific and Clinical Congress in Boston.
    • In a three-month evaluation in 60 type 2 diabetics under care at Kaiser Permanente in Southern California, the use of V-Go improved glycemic control in patients who were uncontrolled with prior regimens. Specifically, 60% of the patients had A1C levels above 9% (target is a maximum of 7%) prior to using V-Go which dropped to 22% after three months' use. In addition, significant reductions in A1C (-1.3%) and total daily dose (TDD) of insulin (-24 Units/day) were observed (both statistically significant).
    • Results from a pilot study involving seven type 2 diabetics who were on stable doses of at least three insulin injections/day before switching to V-Go for ~five weeks showed a 35% increase in average time in range while TDD decreased 39%.
    • The FDA approved V-Go in December 2010.
    • Previously: Valeritas' V-Go wearable insulin delivery device shows treatment benefit in type 2 diabetics in real-world study; shares up 8% premarket (April 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:54 AM

  • AMGN

    FDA OKs Amgen and Novartis' migraine med Aimovig

    • Amgen (NASDAQ:AMGN) and collaboration partner Novartis (NYSE:NVS) announce that the FDA has approved Aimovig (erenumab-aooe) for the prevention of migraine in adults.
    • The calcitonin gene-related peptide receptor (CGRP-R) blocker is a self-administered once/month via Amgen's SureClick autoinjector.
    • The U.S. price is $575 per 70 mg or 140 mg single-use autoinjector or $6,900 per year. Patient out-of-pocket costs could be as low as $5 per month depending on insurance coverage. Commercial availability should commence within one week.
    • Under their 2015 neuroscience collaboration, the companies will co-promote Aimovig in the U.S. while Amgen owns exclusive rights in Japan and Novartis the rest of the world.
    • Novartis' marketing application in Europe is currently under review with a decision expected in the coming months.
    • AMGN is up 1% and NVS a fraction premarket, both on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:05 AM | 5 Comments
